TI Contribution to a better knowledge of the genera Ctenophthalmus
   Kolenati, 1856, and Stenoponia Jordan & Rothschild, 1911 (Siphonaptera,
   Ctenophthalmidae).
FT Contribution a une meilleure connaissance des genres Ctenophthalmus
   Kolenati, 1856, et Stenoponia Jordan & Rothschild, 1911 (Siphonaptera,
   Ctenophthalmidae).
AU Beaucournu, Jean-Claude (jeanclaude.beaucournu@gmail.com) 
SO Bulletin de la Societe Entomologique de France
VL 116
IS 1
PS 57-61
PD Mar 2011
PY 2011
LA French
U1 0
U2 0
AB In comparison with other taxa of the sub-genus Medioctenophthalmus
   Hopkins & Rothschild, 1966, the russulae-group shows differences, not
   only anatomical, but also ecological and parasitological.
   Phylogenetically, the author considers necessary to isolate this group
   in a new subgenus, Smitictenophthalmus n. subgen. Stenoponia
   tripectinata (Tiraboschi, 1902) is isolated from all other fleas
   previously included in this taxon by Jordan, 1958.
C1 Beaucournu, Jean-Claude; Fac Med, Inst Parasitol Ouest, 2 Ave Prof Leon
   Bernard, Rennes, France, France.

AB Six species of Scatopsidae are recorded for the first time from Morocco.
   One species, Reichertella maroccana Haenni n. sp., is described as new
   and figured. The presence of two other species of special interest,

   1936), is discussed.

PT J
AN ZOOR14707047805
DT Article
TI Aedeomyia Theobald, 1901, from afro-tropical and Malagasy regions
   (Diptera, Culicidae).
FT Les Aedeomyia Theobald, 1901, des regions afro-tropicale et malgache
   (Diptera, Culicidae).
AU Brunhes, Jacques (jacques.brunhes@free.fr) 
   Bousses, Philippe
   Ramos, Helena da Cunha
SO Bulletin de la Societe Entomologique de France
VL 116
IS 1
PS 99-128
PD Mar 2011
PY 2011
LA French
U1 0
U2 0
AB The taxonomic analysis of more than one hundred Aedeomyia adults and
   near two hundred larvae coming from Madagascar and the African
   continent, enabled us to illustrate and specify the morphological
   characters of Aedeomyia from these regions and also to describe a new
   species from the Malagasy region. All the specimens belong to the
   collection of the Institut de Recherche pour le Developpement (IRD)
   (Montpellier, France). The type of Aedeomyia africana having been lost,
   we designate a neotype based on our description of a complete series
   coming from Burkina Faso. The authors present the redescription of all
   forms of Aedeomyia (Aedeomyia) furfurea, based on the same population.
   This study also allowed us to highlight the existence of a new species,
   Aedeomyia (Aedeomyia) madagascarica n. sp. The redescription of
   Aedeomyia (Aedeomyia) pauliani Grjebine is completed and we redrew its
   larva. We hereby present the synonymy, the composition of the
   type-series, the biology and its role as a vector of viruses.
   Identification keys for adults, pupae and larvae are proposed.
C1 Brunhes, Jacques; 79 Rue Pasteur, Aubiere, France, France.
EM jacques.brunhes@free.fr
SC Infectious Diseases; Zoology
SN 0037-928X
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; New taxa; Type material; Diagnosis;
   Description; Taxonomy; Key; Parasites diseases and disorders;
   Transmission; Land zones; Afrotropical region; Africa
DE Aedeomyia [Transmission of viruses /  / Systematics] [Afrotropical
   region /  / biology] [Africa /  / Key to species] [Madagascar /  / ] [ /
    / ]. 
   Aedeomyia (Aedeomyia) madagascarica [Madagascar /  / New species]. 
TN Arthropods; Insects; Invertebrates; True Flies

   Aedeomyia (Aedeomyia) africana - Neveu-Lemaire 1906 (Culicidae):
   [Neotype designated, P. 110; Description, P. 111]. 
   Aedeomyia (Aedeomyia) madagascarica (Culicidae): [Sp nov, Madagascar, P.
   119].

   [Redescription, P. 117].

PT J
AN ZOOR14708060150
DT Article
TI Two new species of freshwater gobies of the genus Luciogobius
   (Perciformes: Gobiidae) from Japan.
AU Kanagawa, Naoyuki (naokanagawa@par.odn.ne.jp) 
   Itai, Takahiko
   Senou, Hiroshi
SO Bulletin of the Kanagawa Prefectural Museum Natural Science
VL 40
PS 67-74
PD Mar 2011
PY 2011
LA English
U1 0
U2 4
AB Two new species of the goby genus Luciogobius, i.e. L. fonticola and L.
   fluvialis, are described on the basis of 23 specimens of each species
   from freshwater in rivers entering Suruga Bay, on the Pacific coast of
   Shizuoka Prefecture, southern Japan. L. fonticola is distinguished from
   other members of the genus by the following combination of characters:
   eye small and degenerated, embedded beneath skin, obscured after
   fixation; no scales on body; dermal ridge on cheek without barbels;
   second dorsal-fin origin slightly anterior to anal fin; pelvic fin
   present; no free soft rays on upper and lower ends of pectoral fin;
   second dorsalfin rays modally I, 8; anal-fin rays modally I, 8; branched
   caudal-fin rays modally 8+7; vertebrae modally 15+16=31; interorbit
   region flat; upper jaw length 10.5[plus or minus]1.1% (mean[plus or
   minus]standard deviation) in standard length, 39.2[plus or minus]4.8% in
   head length; predorsal length 261.2[plus or minus]12.9% in head length;
   preanal length 267.9[plus or minus]14.2% in head length; caudal peduncle
   depth 7.3[plus or minus]0.8% in standard length. The other species, L.
   fluvialis is characterized by having the following combination of
   characters: eye small and degenerated, embedded beneath skin, obscured
   after fixation; no scales on body; dermal ridge on cheek without
   barbels; second dorsal-fin origin slightly anterior to anal fin; pelvic
   fin present; no free soft rays on upper and lower ends of pectoral fin;
   second dorsalfin rays modally I, 9; anal-fin rays modally I, 9; branched
   caudal-fin rays modally 8+7; vertebrae modally 16+16=32; interorbit
   region flat; maximum width of head at cheek 11.5[plus or minus]0.9%
   (mean[plus or minus]standard deviation) in standard length; upper jaw
   length 8.5[plus or minus]1.0% in standard length, 37.4[plus or
   minus]3.9% in head length; predorsal length 307.4[plus or minus]15.7% in
   head length; preanal length 315.8[plus or minus]17.1% in head length.
C1 Kanagawa, Naoyuki; Shizuoka High School, 66 Hase, Aoi, Shizuoka
   420-8608, Japan, Japan.
EM naokanagawa@par.odn.ne.jp

PT J
AN ZOOR14708060152
DT Article
TI Formicidae (Insecta: Hymenoptera) from the island of Minami-iwo-to, the
   Volcano Islands, with descriptions of two new species.
AU Terayama, Mamoru (terayama@fa2.so-net.ne.jp) 
   Kubota, Masao
   Karube, Haruki
   Matsumoto, Koichi
SO Bulletin of the Kanagawa Prefectural Museum Natural Science
VL 40
PS 75-80
PD Mar 2011
PY 2011
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB Eight species of ants belonging to 7 genera of 3 subfamilies are
   recorded from the island of Minami-iwo-to, the Volcano Islands, Japan.
   Among them, Temnothorax mekira and Camponotus iwoensis are described as
   new to science, and 4 species, Hypoponera nippona, H. bondoroiti,
   Monomorium chinensis and Paratrechina amia, are recorded from this
   island for the first time.
C1 Terayama, Mamoru; 2-12-29 Nakacho, Saitama 339-0054, Japan, Japan.
EM terayama@fa2.so-net.ne.jp
SC Zoology

   Pacific Ocean islands

   species].

   systematics].

   Formicoidea, Formicidae

   Volcano Islands, P. 78].

PT J
AN ZOOR15401005749
DT Article
TI Additional Monorchiid Digeneans (Trematoda) from Fishes of Japanese and
   Adjacent Waters.
AU Machida, Masaaki
SO Bulletin of the National Museum of Nature and Science Series A Zoology
VL 37
IS 1
PS 1-8
PD Mar 2011
PY 2011
LA English
U1 0
U2 2
AB Six species of monorchiid digeneans are reported from fishes of Japanese
   and adjacent waters. Two new species are described: Lasiotocus
   okinawaensis sp. nov. from Plectorhinchus gibbosus (Haemulidae) from
   Japan, and Opisthomonorchis orwidal sp. nov. from Carangoides sp.
   (Carangidae) from Palau, western Caroline Islands. One new combination
   is made: Lasiotocus sparui (Shen, 1990) comb. nov. from Acanthopagus sp.
   (Sparidae) from Palawan, the Philippines. Three previously known species
   are shortly redescribed: Alloproctotrema gerres Machida, 1973 from
   Gerres oyena (Gerreidae) from Japan and Palawan, Opisthomonorcheides
   decapteri Parukhin, 1966 from Rastralliger kanagurta (Scombridae) from
   Palawan, and Pseudoproctotrema parupenei Yamaguti, 1942 from
   Mulloidichthys vanicolensis (Mullidae) from Japan. The relationship
   between Anamonorchis ulua Yamaguti, 1970 and Hurleytrema carangoidis
   Machida, 2005 is briefly discussed.
C1 Machida, Masaaki; Natl Museum Nat & Sci, Dept Zool, 3-23-1 Hyakunin cho,
   Tokyo, 1690073, Japan, Japan.
SC Parasitology; Zoology
SN 1881-9052
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; New taxa; Description; Combination; Taxonomy;
   Taxonomic position; Parasites diseases and disorders; Parasites;
   Helminth parasites; Hosts; Marine zones; Pacific Ocean
DE Carangoides [Digenean parasites / Opisthomonorchis orwidal / New
   parasite species] [North Pacific / Palau / New platyhelminth parasite
   species]. 
   Lasiotocus okinawaensis [Piscean hosts / Plectorhinchus gibbosus / New
   parasite species] [North Pacific / Japan / New species from piscean
   host]. 
   Monorchiidae [Piscean hosts /  / Systematics] [North Pacific / Japan &
   adjacent waters / ]. 
   Opisthomonorchis orwidal [Piscean hosts / Carangoides / New parasite
   species] [North Pacific / Palau / New species from piscean host]. 
   Pisces [Digenean parasites / Monorchiidae / Parasite systematics] [North
   Pacific / Japan & adjacent waters / ]. 
   Plectorhinchus gibbosus [Digenean parasites / Lasiotocus okinawaensis /
   New parasite species] [North Pacific / Japan / New platyhelminth
   parasite species]. 
TN Chordates; Fish; Invertebrates; Platyhelminths; Vertebrates
ST Animalia, Chordata, Vertebrata, Pisces, Osteichthyes, Actinopterygii,
   Perciformes, Carangidae, Haemulidae, Platyhelminthes, Trematoda, Digenea
OR Pisces (Vertebrata): [Host]. 
   Carangoides (Carangidae): [Host]. 
   Plectorhinchus gibbosus (Haemulidae): [Host]. 
   Alloproctotrema gerres - Machida 1973 (Digenea): [Redescription, P. 1]. 
   Anamonorchis ulua - Yamaguti 1970 (Digenea): [Status, P. 7]. 
   Genolopa sparui - Shen 1990 (Digenea): [Referred to, Lasiotocus, p. 3]. 
   Hurleytrema carangoidis - Machida 2005 (Digenea): [Status, P. 7]. 
   Lasiotocus okinawaensis (Digenea): [Sp nov, Japan (marine), Parasite of
   Plectorhinchus gibbosus (Pisces), p. 2; Parasite]. 
   Lasiotocus sparui - (Shen 1990) (Digenea): [Comb nov, Transferred from
   Genolopa, p. 3]. 
   Monorchiidae (Digenea): [Parasite].

   P. 3]. 
   Opisthomonorchis orwidal (Digenea): [Sp nov, Palau (marine), Parasite of
   Carangoides (Pisces), p. 4; Parasite]. 
   Pseudoproctotrema parupenei - Yamaguti 1942 (Digenea): [Redescription,
